page.title: 16SERVICES IN NORTH HOLMWOOD
page.content: HEALTH AND FIRE SERVICES: There is a health centre situated on the south side of the A24 roundabout.The number of patients has grown since it was opened in 1955.Two doctors (Mr.and Mrs.Goode),nursing and pharmacy services are available.The most common complaint the doctors treat is Coryza (common cold).They see about 52 patients a day both children and adults equally but more females than males! The ambulance station in Spook Hill serves the whole of the Dorking area.Emergencies are taken to the main hospital in Redhill. The Fire service is situated next to the ambulance station and covers the same area. The fire men fight on average 1 fire every week and often use their advanced rescue services for road accidents.
